topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Managed Service Connectivity Procedures for Developers

section.p: These procedures describe the steps that developers must take to create a user-provided service and bind it to applications during deployment.
section.note: The administrative procedures that create and connect the service instance or cluster with the ALS cluster must be completed before the developer procedures will work.
section.p:
The following application services come built-in with HPE Helion Development Platform:
Database Service (Trove): MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, Vertica Preview (single instances and clusters)
Message Broker: RabbitMQ clusters
Typically, application services can be bound to an ALS cluster via the standard Cloud Foundry User Provided Service mechanism.

p.note: MySQL instances and clusters are bound to ALS clusters via the Service Gateway mechanism.
